newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia's Megawati attends police questioning.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia's Megawati attends police questioning.

text.p: Ousted Indonesian minority party leader Megawati Sukarnoputri was questioned by police on Monday for a second time over the organisation of a political rally at her home in January.

Witnesses said Megawati, daughter of the late founding president Sukarno, entered the South Jakarta Police Headquarters with her lawyers at around 11 a.m. (0400 GMT) after waving to a crowd of around 500 supporters, who shouted "Megawati will win".
Riot police stood guard but there was no violence.

Megawati was ousted as leader of the Indonesian Democratic Party by a government-backed rival in June last year. Police have said the meeting at her house was illegal because she did not inform authorities about it.
